title.narrative: 2.4 MULTI-SECTOR NUTRITION PLAN MINISTRIES AND PARTNERS HAVE INCREASED CAPACITY T

description.narrative: 2.4 Multi-Sector Nutrition Plan sector Ministries and partners have increased capacity to legislate, plan and budget to improve nutrition interventions, including mainstreaming DRR to plan for, respond to and mitigate the effects of disasters, which contributes to Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition (Covid), Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2. Nutrition: By 2022, children including adolescent girls and women of reproductive age have improved and equitable access to and use of adequate nutritious diet and improved nutritional care behaviour and care practices.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2.4 Multi-Sector Nutrition Plan sector Ministries and partners have increased capacity to legislate, plan and budget to improve nutrition interventions, including mainstreaming DRR to plan for, respond to and mitigate the effects of disasters

description.narrative: UNICEF's continuous advocacy, technical and financial support to the government of Nepal formed nutrition and food security steering committee (NFSSC) have been formed and capacitated at 308 local governments and 7 provinces which are leading for planning, monitoring, review and fund allocation for MSNP amounting US$ 182 Million for Nutrition sensitive and US$ 20 Million for nutrition specific interventions. Similarly, UNICEF jointly with MOHP leading nutrition cluster and addressing nutrition in emergencies through effective preparedness readiness in emergency situation. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/12/2019

title.narrative: National or local Nutrition sector plans integrate risk management strategies addressing risks related to disasters, climate change, conflict, public health emergencies or other crises
Percent allocation of sectoral budget for nutrition specific
Existence of a functional national multisectoral committee for nutrition
Percent allocation of sectoral budget from Ministry of Federal Affairs and General Administration, Provincial and Local governments for nutrition sensitive
